Reviews.Title: “Natalia”
Reviews.Author: Natalia5112
Reviews.Content: Good staff, speaks Russian. Breakfast is good (ham, sausage,cheese,eggs vegetables), well-served, with soul. I feeled like home. Close from Tegel airport, 20 minutes by bus 109. Bus stop is in front of the hotel. Good connection with the city centre. It takes 15 min. S-Bahn stop is in a 5 minutes walk. Direct S-Bahn line to Potsdam. Good price. Clean room (#29). There are lots of shops around. No lift. No hairdryer in the room. Lack of hangers in the cupboard. Only three for 2 persons.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great breakfast too”
Reviews.Author: kendal6mintcake
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adam was in a great location 3 minutes from Charlottenburgh S Bahn station. The rooms were clean and well decorated. Good security with a locked Courtyard. The staff were excellent and friendly staying late to let me in after a late flight and helping with my luggage storage at the end of my stay. Breakfast was a feast and very enjoyable . Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Swans25
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and son-in-law travel on a budget and booked Hotel Adam for the four of us for our visit to Berlin. For only 36 euro we didn't expect much. From the street this hotel is unimpressive, but once you get beyond the lobby, the remodeled rooms are large, pleasant and very clean; the room overlooked a quiet courtyard. Our private bathroom had been beautifully updated and decorated. The continental breakfast--an extra perk--was very satisfying. The owners obviously take pride in their business. Hotel Adam is only 1/2 block from the Bahn, 1/2 mile from a huge shopping area, and just around the corner from trendy restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ana_sienkiewicz
Reviews.Content: it's not Hilton, but for the it's excellent spot for shoestring budget travelling, it has excellent location and the breakfast buffet makes you wanna stay there forever, plus the rooms are clean and cosy

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, and good location”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySpangles100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now when I've been doing budget trips to Berlin for art exhibitions. For 40 Euros a night (which is what I paid) you can't grumble. The rooms are clean and the breakfast good. For sure you can get bigger rooms and bigger breakfasts in Berlin but expect to pay three times the amount. Great location right next to Charlottenberg S Bahn station. Lovely cafe/bar round the corner where they do a great steak and bernaise sauce, called the Cafe Dollinger on Stuttgarter Platz.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Wendy H
Reviews.Content: If you need a cheap hotel in Berlin this is a good choice. The rooms are somewhat quirky, but they are well heated, have comfortable, though small, beds, and are very quite. Breakfast was very good quality for a 2 star hotel, and there is free wifi. The hotel also has good transport links. If you arrive by bus from Tegel airport, get off at the 2nd Charlottenberg stop. The first is about 20 minutes walk from the hotel !

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value in a Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: jay g
Reviews.Content: You've heard the expression, "Location, location, location." Well, it really applies here. You are across the street from the Charlottenburg S-Bahn station, 19 minutes away from Tegel Airport by the 109 bus, across the street from a 24/7 Russian diner ("Café Rossíya"), and about a block away from the Buon Giorno Pizzeria on Kantstrasse, which make a huge bowl of Rigatoni Bolognese for 4.5 euros! The B&B is gemütlich (i.e. homey), and it includes breakfast, which I never tried. My room with private bath cost $55. The neighborhood is a mix of Turkish, Asian, German and Russian, with a gigantic, half-block long Asian supermarket across the street. The hotel has excellent wi-fi for free. Will definitely go back. Also go to the Tourist office at the Main train station (4 stops away on the S-bahn) and buy a 3-day museum pass ("Lustschau"), which gives you free admission to about 60 museums in a three-day period - cost: $27 (20 euros). A five-day transpo pass for the city is $38/28 euros and well worth it. Come here and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and good value”
Reviews.Author: JohnPaul1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what our small group of adult students needed: a place in Berlin that was a "real hotel" (as opposed to a hostel or traveller place), with good accessability to the city and the sites, offering a decent breakfast included and all for a very reasonable price. Everyone was happy ...well, one pair said that there was a bit of a smell of smoke from their room, that's all. Booking was easy via e-mail, paying on arrival suited us perfectly. The lovely castle of Schloss Charlottenburg is within walking distance and proved a good starting point for us on early arrival and waiting for all the rooms to get ready. It is almost right beside the S-bahn station that gets you into downtown really fast, the metro -U-Bahn is just down the road, the airport bus stops right at the front door -only EUR 2.30 single. All very handy.

Reviews.Title: “"Does what it says on the tin!" Thanks, TA, for the top tip.”
Reviews.Author: HUHoney60
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I needed for a 7 day/6 night combined business/leisure stay. Location is fantastic for transport links, and its less-than-idyllic nighttime look contributes to its low cost. However, it is *completely safe* (3 keys to get to your room, and a videophone entry at reception until 2300) and set back from the street in a private courtyard. Management gave me the double for the whole week so that I wouldn't have to swap - a welcome gift! Room 12 was warm and clean, and I never missed the room phone or other amenities. Hallway bathroom was as expected, but the hot water is nonexistent no matter the time or the day of the week. Reception desk is largely useless for tourist info and transport suggestions, and you have to hope that you get a receptionist who has strong English fluency (they all understand, but don't all respond); however, as it is a security desk and not a concierge, this is also to be expected! Would definitely return if traveling to Berlin -- book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, basic but close to Charlottenburg Station and includes breakfast”
Reviews.Author: doubledoubleswifty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room with ensuite for 5 days. The advantages of staying in this hotel were that: -Opposite to Charlottenburg Station. 5 stops to Berlin Central Station. -Good price -Breakfast included. However breakfast is the same selection everday. Included was a selection of cereals, tea, coffee etc. Bread, hotdog sausages, boiled eggs, different types of ham, different types of cheese...So choice for hot food was definitely limited. -Rooms were very quiet and cleaned everyday -Very cheap sushi restaurant round the corner! -The owner(?) was very friendly and answered all our questions -Airport express to Potsdam and Schonenfeld Airport stopped at Charlottenburg Disadvantages: -We only came back to the hotel to sleep as most of the attractions are in Mitte area but still did not take very long to travel back -The ensuite shower drove us mad! Had to keep controlling the tap every other minute to stop you from getting burnt or hypothermia! -Our room was located on the 2nd floor so I would not recommend it for people who may require an elevator -Receptionist did not speak much English and had difficulty understanding us -The surrounding area was rather boring and a bit dodgy. There were some adult men clubs. However we never had any problems walking back at night

Reviews.Title: “See you soon”
Reviews.Author: Cickany
Reviews.Content: We selected this place based on the reviews and we were not disappointed. Simple but clean accommodation, extremely helpful staff. The hotel itself is part of a block of flats or rather used to be a block of flats; the reception and hotel entrance (two different doors) can be reached after crossing an inner courtyard. The place itself is peaceful and quiet. The hotel is clearly signposted, it is easily visible from the street. The area is not particularly attractive (with a red light night club next to the hotel), but the bus stop transporting passengers to and from Tegel airport is right in front of the building and the underground station isn’t far, either. This might be a kind of Russian quarter with a Russian supermarket nearby and the Russian staff. The pros: helpful staff, good value, not central but still excellent location, good breakfast. The cons: quality of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just simple.”
Reviews.Author: travelling_in_20s
Reviews.Content: If you just want a place to dump your luggage and explore Berlin, then this is definitely the place. The area around Charlottenburg is fabulous, and many shops (including a shopping arcade) are located nearby, particularly near Wilmersdorfer Arcaden which is a 3-4 minute east from the hotel. The hotel can be reached from Tegel airport by bus S-109 for 2.10 euro. The hotel isn't super fancy, and occasionally there is some night time partying noise, but overall it is fine. There is no refrigerator, so you may have to settle for room-temperature beverages you buy elsewhere. Berlin does have clean drinking water from the tap, though. The breakfast is, wonderful. A nice variety, though it will feel like it is the same after a few days. The breakfast room is very clean and the staff is friendly. I also went jogging and found the very pristine Lietzensee Park nearby. A wonderful haven if you just don't like the hotel area. If you like to have a beverage at a table outdoor at night, then there plenty of places around the immediate area. So the bottom line is this: If you expect fresh towels from room service, a mint on the bed, and a bell boy - don't even think about it. If you want a compromise between squeaky clean and a savings in money - this is pretty good, and includes breakfast. If you always do things as cheap as possible - go for a hostel instead.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: MsMorgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Adam for 2 nights while sightseeing in Berlin. It is located next to the S-bahn station and 2 U-Bahn stations are within a 5 minute walk. A lot of restaurants and snack stands nearby and a pedestrian shopping zone is also within a 5 minute walk. The street where the hotel located is a little questionable. There were several gentlemen clubs and women propositioning on the streets. However, I did not feel unsafe in this area. The halls and reception area are pretty run-down and shabby. Surprisingly, the rooms are very clean and a little small, but OK just for sleeping. There is no phone or Internet connection, but there are a couple of cheap Internet cafe's nearby. The hotel is not directly on the street, however being a light sleeper, I heard a lot of street noise. We parked our car in a lot just outside the hotel and paid a 50 EUR deposit to use the hotel's parking pass. You must keep your receipt in order to get your deposit back. I had misplaced mine and luckily found it. Without it, I think there would have been a little problem getting the deposit back. Finding a parking space was not a problem and we did not use our car during our stay. The S-Bahn is much more convenient and easier to get around from place to place. This hotel does not contain any frills and is a good value for the money. If you are going to Berlin to sightsee and shop, you can save money by booking this hotel. If you want a luxurious hotel with all of the frills and extras, this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Trickmyself
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, simple hotel in a good location close to bus routes and the S-Bahn Charlottenburg station. We paid 55 euro and were supposed to share a bathroom, but were given a room with a bathroom in it anyway, which was nice. Reception staff were pleasant and the room was smallish but clean, quiet and comfortable. There is no internet. Breakfast was nice, but a bit of a weird atmosphere, as there were staff standing behind blinds at the food table watching everyone and whispering. Made us a bit uncomfortable trying to eat our breakfast! Overall though a good value hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nealjking_njk
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate in size; there was a TV set, but I didn't use it. I chose a room with included bathroom, but the rate is lower for a room lacking that (bathroom down the hall). Breakfast buffet included, quite decent. No WLAN; but there is a very inexpensive internet cafe around the corner. The hotel is very close to the Charlottenburg S-Bahn station, and has many restaurants nearby. The hotel manager was quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: natvy1983
Reviews.Content: Not in the centre of town but next door to train station and tubes, so very easy to get to from the airport. A bit tacky but clean and cheap. Breakfast is included and the buffet is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a budget, this is a good place to stay and save some $.”
Reviews.Author: ChicaVika14
Reviews.Content: We started our trip in Berlin and spent 2 nights at Hotel Adam. The hotel is only a few minutes walking from the Charlottenburg S Bahn stop, which makes it very convenient to hop on the S-bahn and 15 minutes later or so, you're at Alexanderplatz. Although the location was not very central, we felt lke we were a short ride away from the sights. The room is small, but has a sink. It was clean and the beds pretty comfortable. The shared bathroom was always clean and always had soap and paper towels. Shower was also always clean. Our rate included breakfast, which was great! They had a variety of cheese and cold cuts. Bread and rolls with jams and butter. Weinerwurst and hard boiled eggs. Coffee, tea, juices. It was the nice. The lady at the front, Inna, was very nice and helpful. We felt very safe during our stay, and it was nice a quiet! The only thing that bothered us, was it seemed like towards the end of our stay, something in the room made us cough quite a bit. But overall, great stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap as chips & clean as a whistle”
Reviews.Author: eyedoclondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adam Kaiser-Friedrich-Straße 51A, 10627 Charlottenburg, Berlin A hidden treasure in Berlin - 20 Apr 2009 What a fabulous little hotel. Doesn't look like much on the not-so-pretty end of Kaiser-Friedrichstraße with some "interesting" gentleman's bars just outside. However enter the main doors into the courtyard and it is tranquility itself. Reception looks shoddy and the hallways up to the rooms gives the most awful impression. However - and it is a big however - once you enter each apartment (each with about 5 separate rooms) the rooms themselves are bright, very quiet with no street noise at all and spotlessly clean. Small but functional bathrooms and again scrupulously clean. If you are a clean & neat freak like me, you'll feel right at home. Breakfast included is excellent - goodly amounts of food. You can have a typical German breakfast with cheeses & ham etc or a typical American/British breakfast of cereals, toast, preserves etc. All in plentiful supply. I found that having a good breakfast stopped me eating rubbish all day. The best thing however is that just outside the building is the bus stop for the 109 bus that takes you all the way along the Ku'damm to the Zoo Station. From there the 100 wil take you all the way to the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, Unter Den Linden and all the way down to Alexanderplatz - thus including virtually everywhere on the typical tourists itnierary. And also the 109 from the opposite end of the street will take you all the way back to Tegel! Even better is that the Charlottenberg S & U bahn station is only a few moments walk from here - with the trains taking you all the way to Hauptbahnhof - again only minutes walk from the Reichstag & Brandenburg gate. Going the opposite direction on the train is Spandau which is well worth the trip. Anyway, I am digressing. This is the best value - immaculate rooms, right in the middle of Charlottenburg with great public transport links to all the main places. Right around the corner on the corner of Stuttgarter Platz & Leonhard Straße are some great little shops & cafés: El Gato Azul is a fabulous German owned tapas bar. The wines and tapas are amazing - and it such a cool friendly atmosphere. There are a whole load of other bars on the way there though - some of which are quite delightful. Great little budget hotel, great breakfast, decent prices. Save the money staying here instead of somewhere more expensive and spend what you save in some of the amazing bars in the locale.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: SIGRIDLUKE
Reviews.Content: Basic, very clean room & bathroom. friendly srevice. great, all you can eat breakfast, included. 1 minute walk to train staion. definatley recommended to budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: neimi
Reviews.Content: The area is lively but somehow you feel safe around there. Even during the night I have never felt uncomfortable. The station is about 100 meters away. When you walk Kantstrasse to the city you spot many restaurants. Rooms are very, very clean. Bathrooms are perfecly clean too. Some of the rooms have even TV (I think the price of the room with TV and bathroom was around 50-60 euros...). The prices include the breakfast which is very good. You can even eat outside. All the rooms we lived in (we lived in four different rooms during our stay) had window to the little patio. There was quiet in the rooms. Lovely. Rooms are spacious, well-lighted and beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: suuzinSF
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is located in Charlottenburg, just a 2-minute walk from the S-Bahn which was incredibly convenient. The neighborhood is perhaps just a touch sketchy but even as a single woman traveling alone I wasn't really concerned, and all rooms are well off the street (no noise). The rooms are pretty basic but comfortable and I paid only 36 euro/night for a twin room with private bath. Breakfast was quite good and service was excellent. They may ask you for full payment up front, but I paid just one night and the balance the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Just a room in an old house (bath shared among 6/8 rooms)”
Reviews.Author: Selti
Reviews.Content: For young people that don't want to spend too much money it might be ok, though I think youth hostels are better. It was an old pension and the room had no bath. It was cold and even the parking was charged. Not againg.
